segments.text: no , I can handle it . Thanks anyway .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: are you sure you don't need any help ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , maybe just a little . I can't seem to make it fit .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I swear , the overhead compartments on these planes just keep getting smaller and smaller !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's so true . thanks for your help . Are you in the aisle seat in this row ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: oh , I guess I'll let you through then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: thanks . sorry for making you get out of your seat again .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's alright . I notice you have a few newspapers there . Would you mind lending me one ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: no , not at all . Which one would you like--the New York Times or the Guardian ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I prefer the British paper , but I'll read whatever one you aren't going to read right away .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I was just going to do a little Sudoku while we wait for the plane to take off , so the Guardian is all yours .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: thanks a lot . That's really nice of you . Would you like a piece of gum ?
segments.speaker: S1
